Class CircleSolver

java.lang.Object
CircleSolver
public class CircleSolver
extends java.lang.Object
CircleSolver Class File

DESCRIPTION

This class is designed to check if two circles a) intersect, b) do not intersect, or c) are identical to each other. It reads files that give circle parameters and then outputs one of three answers.

METHODS

  • public CircleSolver (String filename) ------------ Constructor for the class.
  • public String checkCircle() ---------------------- Checks relationship between two circles.
  • public static void main (String[] args) ---------- Main method of the class.

    • Constructor Details

      • CircleSolver

        public CircleSolver​(java.lang.String fileName) throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor for the class. Reads a given file and sets a bunch of variables.
        NOTE: This method does not actually do any calculation. That comes later.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String value of the name of the read file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        exception - when radius is negative.

    • Method Details

      • checkCircle

        public java.lang.String checkCircle()
        This method does all of the brute arithmetic needed on the circle, like calculating the distance between each circle, checking intersection, etc....
        Returns:
        String value of the relationship between the circles. The possible relationships are:
        • "in" if a circle is completely inside another circle
        • "out" if the circles are completely separate.
        • "0" if the circles are identical.
        • "1-" if the cirlces are nested and tangent.
        • "1+" if the circles are not tangent but still touch once.
        • "2" if the circles touch twice.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
